creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund and the William Hood Dunwoody Fund
marks: Signature and Date LR in vermillion: [..55 G.COURBET]
text: The country around his native town of Ornans, in eastern France, inspired most of Gustave Courbet's paintings. Like his contemporaries who worked near Barbizon, Courbet revitalized the landscape tradition with views of distinctive regional features observed at first hand. The town of Ornans appears in the valley below.
title: Château d’Ornans
